result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheila M. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:46 p.m. Defendant Sheila M. Thompson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Obstruction, a violation of 946.41(1) - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. State moves to dismiss any citations tracking with this case. Sowinski/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence-Each Count CC
Jail - 8 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, June 10, 2016 at 4:00 p.m.  Each count CC
Jail credit - 3 days
CC/DNA Surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution in the amount of $41.73, includes 10%
Cash bond posted to be applied to restitution and then costs. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 4:06 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery- cover letter

2:47 p.m. Defendant Sheila M. Thompson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Schiek statement that resolution has been reached. Richards requests adjournment for plea/sentencing. Bail continued. Adj. 2:52 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:34 p.m. Defendant Sheila M. Thompson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - Richards in receipt - waives further reading - enters not guilty pleas to both Counts. Bail continued. Adj. 3:36 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Hearing to Defendant - "Return to Sender No mail receptacle Unable to forward"
Notice of Hearing to defendant - "Return to Sender - No mail receptacle-Unable to Forward"

2:44 p.m. Defendant Sheila M. Thompson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan appearing for Attorney Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:45 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

1:35 p.m. Defendant Sheila M. Thompson in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be provided,  right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond. Adj. 1:41 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
